ReSCoSS conformations // DSD-BLYP-D3 reranking // COSMOtherm pKa

column1: # Use as many lines of text as you need.
# All text following the ""Method:"" keyword will be regarded as part of your free text methods description. "
First step to determine relevant microstates:

column3: tautomers and protomers) were evaluated using the ReSCoSS (Relevant Solution Conformer Sampling and Selection) workflow. Conformational sampling was carried out using Macromodel 2017-3 (MCMM method using the OPLS2005 force field and GBSA-water
column4: all-atom RMSD threshold set to 0.75 Å and potential energy cutoff increased to 30 kJ/mol).

column1: The geometries of all conformers were then optimized using the GFN-xTB method employing the GBSA-water model (Grimme
column3: JCTC 2017). Following a BP86/TZVP/COSMO single point
column4: the conformations were clustered by shape diversity and any conformer possessing relevance in either of 10 different COSMO-RS solvents (Water

column1: Single point electronic energies (E_el) were then computed at the PW6B95-D3(BJ)/TZVPD level
column2: with thermochemical properties (G_RRHO) computed at the GFN-xTB/GBSA(water) level and solvation free energies at the COSMO-RS/FINE17 level. The total free energy of each conformer was then obtained as G_tot = E_el + G_solv + G_RRHO (1).

column1: Microstates of the same charge for the same molecule were then compared with regards to their relative free energies and only those microstates for which at least one conformer was within a 10 kcal/mol cutoff value compared to the microstate with the lowest free energy overall were kept.
For relevant microstates carried forward from the first step
column2: all conformers chosen in the clustering step were then fully optimized at the PBE-D3(BJ)/def2-TZVP/COSMO level.

column1: Total free energy values according to eq. (1) above were then evaluated at DSD-BLYP-D3(BJ)/def2-TZVPD// PBE-D3(BJ)/def2-TZVP/COSMO + RRHO[GFN-xTB + GBSA-water] + Gsolv[COSMO-RS(FINE17/TZVPD)] level. For two conformers of SM24_micro020 that did not converge at the DSD-BLYP-D3(BJ)/def2-TZVPD level
column2: we substituted with relative E_ele at PW6B95-D3(BJ)/def2-TZVPD level.

column1: Having determined the relevant microstates and their relative free energies in water (and therefore Boltzmann weights) using the above steps
column2: we then used COSMOtherm pKa (COSMOthermX17.0.5 release and BP-TZVPD-FINE-C30-1701 parameterization) applied to single conformer pairs.

column1: Computing COSMOtherm pKa’s at the single conformer pair level is necessary because COSMOtherm would otherwise Boltzmann-weigh the entire conformer set for each microstate according to COSMO-RS theory without taking into account the relative free energies computed above.

(This is the first submission typeI/II/III-wilcken-1.csv; our second submission typeI/II/III-wilcken-2.csv will report the “standard” COSMOtherm pKa’s for sake of comparison using the same microstate & conformer set). "
